articles.title: Peering Into Ancient Life: New Clues Found in 3.5 Billion-Year-Old Biomass - SciTechDaily
articles.description: To learn about the first organisms on our planet, researchers have to analyze the rocks of the early Earth. These can only be found in a few places on the surface of the Earth. The Pilbara Craton in Western Australia is one of these rare sites: there are rock…
articles.content:
Rocks made of barium sulfate (known as barite rocks) from the Pilbara Craton in Western Australia. Credit: Gerhard Hundertmark
